lucBrVmZZHx7X-j9Jr4IWg.text: I went to the opening and have been enchanted since then. Why?  The CCC is right in the town centre, there is plenty of parking and you get into this amazing, historical building with fantastic natural light. Big windows, great interior design and lots of unique corners to hide or seats to sit and mingle. You can come to work, read, or even bring little ones to play on carpet.  I love, love the book corner and whatever I saw there on the shelf. That's art in itself right there. Leave a book to have an impact on your community.  The atmosphere is so lovely, because this Kaffeehaus is treated like a comfy, welcoming home. Fresh flowers, comfortable armchairs and great color coordination. Forget Starbucks or CTR - they are cold, music is blaring and in a way, they don't really want you to stay.  Last but not at least: beautiful open coffee bar, marble countertop, historic old pieces from post office, best Italian illy coffee and snacks and treats that go beyond what you can expect. No ceran wrapped dry danish, but delicate cupcakes under glassware.  Now I just gotta convince them to open something in my hood ...

nMteHau58IGBlrrkCUdABg.text: This was my second time in Carnegie in a week and I'm so impressed at the little business district! I was excited when a friend suggested meeting for coffee and I quickly suggested this place after passing it earlier this week. It is SO CUTE! It is everything I want in a coffee shop, cozy, inviting and completely unpretentious (not the case throughout Pittsburgh's coffee scene).   I really loved the feel of the space and although I sat at a booth, I am eager to return with a book to hang out in one of the big chairs for an afternoon.    I had a nice cup of tea and the breakfast sandwich on a croissant. My friend had the Illy coffee and really enjoyed it.   I'll definitely be back...and often!

D0k6M2crGgYmBe1t1IIAPw.text: This place is awesome. My mother has raved about this place for a long time, so off we went. I've been there three times. The first time Emily made me an awesome mocha while Robin was perfect. Then the next day two other ladies were there. Today I went back. There was one lady working. She was way less friendly than the other four. I assume her name starts with an "A" given the signature of my frequent flyer card. She seemed off put because there was a line of maybe 4 people. I do plan to go back this week and hope it's awesome again.

3u3B4z6MdkrzbdwfmL9n0w.text: I'm not a big coffee drinker.  I WISH caffeine had did something for me but sadly, I'm left to wake up when my body just decides it's ready.  Regardless, from time to time, I enjoy a hot cup when it's the heat I crave.  Never have I ever said "This coffee is DELICIOUS."  That is, until the first time I tasted the liquid gold at Carnegie Coffee Company.  It was a lovely day several months ago, during the Yelp clothing swap, that I first had the pleasure.  The barista took a great deal of time describing the process and the actually coffee - Illy (the brand) - and poured us as much of the joe as our hearts could manage.  From that point on, I was hooked.  As someone who rarely crosses a bridge if it can be helped, I recently found myself brunching with friends at Altius a couple of weeks ago and I had the strongest craving for Illy. Post-brunch, off we went, all...the...way... to Carnegie Coffee company to enjoy two steaming cups and relaxing conversation in, what can best be described, as the most delightful coffee shop ambiance their ever was.  Now - back to the office pot. Blech.  P.S. The food is delicious too!

wN-QzUnArqJXYeDfh50WHw.text: Really nice place. Lots of places to sit, relax or work.  The little pharmacy and lottery machine is conveniently located inside. I've gone many times usually for a cappuccino. The staff lately are pretty low key and unremarkable. I think they should have a few espresso and engage the customers more but I suppose they don't have to. I usually tip based on their personality or willingness to be nice.

4gjG2tihGjfURZbfrH1IfA.text: Why is this place so fantastic? I don't even know. What a great addition to the scene.  I am from Pittsburgh but now live in NYC and the bagel I had here this morning could rival a NYC bagel.  Support your local businesses, folks. This place is TOP NOTCH!!!!!!!!!

MoLt92SynkN6cXmVSxkQOw.text: Very good espresso and friendly staff. The large latte was excellent. I also had a bacon/egg/cheese on everything bagel which was also good.I  highly recommend trying this place and I will be here again!

4qzh-Z1ShRz4Ml0Vhsfs9A.text: Carnegie Coffee Company is one of the best coffee shops in Pittsburgh! And, it is an excellent venue for an event. I held a graduate school graduation party here for about 50 people.  Space Carnegie Coffee Company is located in a historic old post office building in the heart of Carnegie -- walkable to many downtown Carnegie locations. There is free parking behind the building and a large parking lot across the street as well as on street parking. The interior decor of the building is stellar as old mailboxes are the underpinnings of the main counter in the entrance. The large, old windows frame the space and allow in a large amount of natural light. There is both an upstairs and downstairs that is fit to accommodate the circulation of guests who may want to wander into different portions of the space.  Owner Ashley allowed me to have full reign of the space, which was terrific. I could rearrange the furniture as desired, and the staff physically moved / positioned it for me.   Coffee  The coffee and other drinks at Carnegie Coffee Company are of excellent taste and quality. There is a balanced mixture of fun, experimental new flavorings to try as well as classic drinks and teas, smoothies, etc.   Staff  The onsite staff were fantastic! They were extremely attentive to the needs of the guests and took pride in creating quality coffee drinks. My guests commented on the excellent baristas. These guys also spent time after the event, cleaning and closing things, showing nothing but patience, grace, willingness, kindness, and concern. They had positive attitudes and were extremely professional.   Logistics and planning Owner Ashley was thoughtful, proactive, and communicative in the planning process. She was experienced in this and had creative ideas about how others' had used the space. She was always able to meet and got back to me right away. She offered to help in any way that she could. I believe that Ashley genuinely wanted those who walked into the space to have a great time at my event, which was much appreciated. She allowed me to store some decorations and other items in a storage closet. She was flexible in allowing me to bring in my own food, drinks, etc. I did not have to worry about being nickel and dime for every item I used. I also could easily play my own music over the integrated sound system. Ashley could not have been any more accommodating, organized, and helpful. I am so grateful for her partnership!  After-taste Everyone had a GREAT time at the party, in large part due to the SPECTACULAR venue, coffee drinks, and the service.   Here are what a few of my friends have to say about CCC in regards to my party:  -"The people making drinks were so friendly, responsive, and creative! I wanted to try something totally out of the ordinary and they helped me create my own custom drink!  They also seemed to be genuinely enjoying the celebration, which seems unusual for employees at a party."  -"Very personable barista. Quick to help create a fun concoction!"  -"Incredible atmosphere, so many unique spaces to sit and talk, and a great place reminisce with friends while making new memories."  -"Perfect atmosphere for a private party! Lots of room for 25-35 people yet you can still break away to have private conversations and not feel the crowd around you. Service was stellar- super friendly staff. Very accommodating to allow personal music to be played too. Overall, a great venue for your next private party!!  That's my review Coffee section was on point too. Delicious drinks!"   -"Baristas were very friendly! I remember talking to them for awhile. Great atmosphere, very inviting, felt like I was hanging out at home or a friend's apartment honestly!"  -"Friendly. Accommodating. Attentive. Proactive."  -"I moved to Carnegie because of this place. Carnegie Coffee Company is the crown jewel of a gilded Carnegie."

HWFrD8RhYyukvsvIJex_zw.text: This place stands out as a local joint with great atmosphere.  The former Post Office has been converted into a bright, airy, and open-concept place without losing some of the original interest of the building.  The counter is behind a row of old mailboxes.  There is a brick chimney running through the structure, surely there to conduct heat up from the coal-fired furnace in the basement!  The staff was friendly and competent during my visit.  They offer food, but I just had a snack and a latte.  The drink was served in china, and I was able to snag a second level sunny chair.  If I lived in the area, this would for sure be a hang out for reading, knitting, discussing politics, and just drinking coffee.  I often buy Illy beans to brew at home, and am a big fan of the flavor.  It's so encouraging to see this rugged old town being revitalized.  It's the antithesis of the chain coffee experience in a strip mall with a drive-thru.  Just don't be fooled by the entrance, it really doesn't look like much from the outside, it still has that Post Office vibe from the street.  But inside, it's very hip.

tBo-Wj--dJ_FWbVn8sPFbw.text: I loveeee this space.  And the coffee is excellent!  Carnegie Coffee Company is the only place in Pittsburgh that serves illy coffee and the baristas are all very passionate about their skill!  Usually I'm a straight black coffee type, but visiting Carnegie Coffee Company and talking to the baristas makes me wants to branch out and try everything!  They also carry a wide range of sandwiches, tapa-style snacks, and other yummy sweets!  (A lot of which are locally sourced.)  And back to the decor.  It's so beautiful!  Lots of windows and high ceilings.  It's very clean and calming.  They've got plenty of tables near the front and then sofas, armchairs and benches scattered throughout.  It's totally what I would want my own house to look like!  I would definitely come back to hang out, do work, or host an event!  (Which, they said they do rent out the space as a venue and will soon be able to cater events there as well!)

ezcm4YbBjqUl6TDfg3xDrg.text: This is a must stop if you are near or visiting Carnegie. Located right on the main street in the old post office what a great space.  The owner modeled the shop after European coffee shops and it has a great open feel.  Lots of spaces to sit and relax and free WIFI. The baristas are so nice and helpful. I ordered an iced green mint tea.  They serve pastries and breakfast sandwiches in the morning as well as donuts from a local company, Big Daddy Donut.  For lunch they have sandwiches.  They are BYOB and starting to offer small plates.  They try to use many local ingredients. I tried an appetizer served on French bread with strawberries and honey butter which was delicious. The honey butter was locally made. You can also rent out the space for a bridal or baby shower, work event, birthday party etc.

6Mk9RvxiN2tlrToPnFuUnQ.text: Looking forward to meeting clients and doing work here.   It's a nice, well-lit natural lighting kind of place, and there is ample seating upstairs.  I had the florentine breakfast sandwich on a croissant, which was very tasty.    The attempts at upselling made me a bit uncomfortable.   First on a fruitcup with my sandwich, and then when they didnt have the coconut flavor I asked for, they kept asking if I wanted other fruit flavors, which I kept declining. Other than that - it was a beautiful location, spacious, and I liked the decor.

Q2SjffhZj3R_b7mhAVWgyg.text: Love this place. Been going since it first opened, and still a frequent customer. Excellent classic coffee and cappuccino, and delicious sandwiches, soups, and salads too. Carnegie Classic is a favorite of mine.

zsGHwtoy25s9PwNnurSiGg.text: This is a quiet cafe which is great to sit and work. I like their smoothies especially the peach smoothie.

hemDLNIYlbXXxaAlhtFamw.text: I had wanted to give Carnegie Coffee Company a try, so when the typical (yet unexplained) traffic backup on 376 West (Inbound) got close to a standstill one afternoon, the wife and I decided to jump off the beaten path, grab a joe and take our time.  I had tried to visit CCC a few times before, but their relative early closing times (7pm) and remote distance from downtown typically prevented me from doing so.    Finally entering the place, it shares a really unique space with a pharmacy store in what seems to be an old post office.  The coffee bar itself is relatively simple, with multiple great seating areas throughout the building (upstairs, behind the bar, to the side of the bar, etc.).  I really enjoyed sitting back behind the bar in the "library" and looking through the ton of books they have available to read.  Relative to coffee, they use Illy branded beans and products.  I got a cup of their house medium drip (they keep a dark on as well) and was pleasantly surprised by the natural sweetness of the brew.  My wife's "Harry Potter" (white chocolate, caramel and nougat I believe) latte, while way to sweet for me, was perfect for her.  I doubt I'll ever make a trip specifically for this coffee shop, but anytime I'm in the area I'll definitely take advantage of it!

QAMXgKlLx-PkChdu_GezhQ.text: I was hoping to try out some local coffee in the new Bodum Vacuum coffee maker that I got for Christmas.   Wasn't too excited to find that they had only Illy coffee. Got Sausage breakfast sandwich which wasn't extraordinary. The everything bagel didn't remind us of New York.   The baristas were friendly and cheerful and the environment of the coffee shop inside an old coffee shop is unique, although it's not unthinkable in today's hipster coffee generation. The big windows let plenty of light in and give a nice view of downtown Carnegie with its mix of old and new.  Briefly put, nice ambience but slightly lacking in coffee and food.

QIixPUXBglbN-y__GtCZJQ.text: Good coffee, good people, good atmosphere. Would recommend to any coffee lovers out there.

bqUJ5OPakg4e1YA7NJ5-_g.text: They didn't know what I meant when I asked if they did "pour-over" cups of coffee. Then I said, "single-pour," and still a blank stare. And the other guy working the espresso machine didn't know. And explaining a "single cup of coffee, made individually," didn't help. So, maybe there's a more proper name for it, but I settled for a vacuum carafe-dispensed cup of drip. It was okay. Hot enough. The panini was just okay, too. Feels like the place is someone's hobby, rather than a serious coffee shop.

bMsW0gSC2IocM9Mmr6Kyaw.text: French press is a brewing process, not a type of coffee!!!  This was my first visit and I was hopeful for a good experience. I visit MANY coffee houses and Carnegie has quite a few stars so I was anxious to stop in.  Unfortunately, my first impression is not good.  To begin, the young lady behind the counter greeted me but not with a smile or ANY enthusiasm.  Then, when I asked if they serve French pressed coffee she smugly, and somewhat rudely, replied "Uh, no, this is an Italian coffee shop."  It is? Where is the sign?  And by the way, young lady, French press is a technique, not a coffee type. You CAN French press Italian - or any other type - coffee!  Obviously, the folks behind the counter need more education on coffee brewing techniques.  The coffee itself was uninspired; though the biscotti was delicious and fresh.  The decor, which is raved over quite a bit herein, was, indeed, unique; however, virtually ALL the upholstered chairs (and these were the main seating offered) were/are covered in stains. Pretty disgusting actually.  To add to the less than stellar experience; the same young lady who does not understand what "French pressing" is, was cleaning the floors and bathrooms. This in itself is fine and to be expected. The problem was the potency of the cleaning solution. Wow! When I'm in a coffee shop I want to smell coffee, not chemicals. They permeated the entire shop...both floors.  All-in-all a mediocre experience.  I do not see myself rushing back here when there are so many other great prospects ion the offing.

tlIllFaMTNQVcOt0IHY_dQ.text: My favorite coffee stop around. The shop itself is a unique setting in an old post office with plenty of nooks and crannies to sit down to enjoy your coffee/snack. Great place to get some work done as there are some seats and tables upstairs as well. Delicious cappuccinos and lots of delicious menu items as well!

_Tbk4CshZN4KIR6bpzgYiQ.text: Such a cute coffee shop.  Located in the old post office, it splits its space with the Medicine Shoppe, though the coffee shop has more room.  There are tables, counters along the windows, benches against one wall, a siting area with books, and another private-er sitting area.  That's just on the main floor.  There's also a loft where you can reserve rooms for meetings and where they host yoga sessions on the first and third Sunday of the month.  The barista told me there was an art opening there, which I'm assuming will be a regular happening as well.  Now, the barista.  He was fantastic.  Mark, I believe is his name, was very helpful.  I told him it was my first time there and I'm not picky, though I usually go for plain coffee.  He suggested adding salted caramel syrup to the dark roast; he did not let me down.  It was fragrant, flavorful, and satisfied my afternoon sweet attack without being "too much."  He also told me the history of the building, gave me menus and cards to take home, and then came over to my table to offer more info after I sat down.  Very personable and A+ service from him.  The manager, though, left a lot to be desired.  He walked around with his phone glued to his hands (and practically his nose) and didn't seem to be doing much of anything but text/play games.  He walked by someone standing at the counter waiting for service and I didn't even hear a greeting, even though I was fairly close to them.  Thankfully, Mark was a step behind him - no doubt used to that!  Next time I'd like to try some delicious-looking pastries or a sandwich that they make fresh while you wait - there's a huge menu of bistro-style offerings.  I'm dying to try the grilled PB&J.  I believe they also have salads and soups and grab-and-go options if you are unable to wait.  If I lived closer, this would be a contender for "my new spot."   It was a little drafty, though, and the manager was very off-putting.  The coffee and other workers made up for that, though.

fREYMhHjRJWOSazYQNPwwA.text: Excellent coffee house with a very friendly staff.  The breakfast and lunch menus are good and the specials are usually interesting.  Drink-wise, they have all of the coffee, tea, and juice drinks one would expect, but the barista skills are significantly better than at a chain coffee house.  The staff are welcoming and funny!

DWH1aFwvkrORBpwSuAxobw.text: i live nearby so i go here all the time and i love it! i'd recommend going to anyone who loves coffee and/or tea.

CTpT9wfsYbx3TqkupktiEg.text: Love CCC! Coffee tastes great and food is usually very good. I had the BEST cinnamon chip muffin there! Love that the pastries are homemade.

4NV5mh6v-ydM2E5ype4Zrg.text: I've been coming here for a while and I honestly struggle with determining how to review it. Maybe 2.5 stars would be more realistic, as I don't think its quite as bad as 2 stars suggests, but I'm not sure the 3 star "A-OK" descriptor is really honest.   The first couple times I went were great -- good coffee (some really interesting lattes), decent service, and the atmosphere is super cool (although I'll agree with someone else's review that the armchairs are pretty stained and gross). Each time I've gone since then has gotten progressively worse. The service is pretty lackluster in terms of warmth and welcome (they just kind of stand at the register and stare at you blankly until you start ordering) and I've frequently had to repeat simple two-drink orders several times for the cashier to ring it up, but more importantly it's S-L-O-W. There have been one or two times that I ordered food and it took long enough that I genuinely wondered if they had forgotten about it. The sandwiches I've gotten have been great, although I ordered a Honus Wagner on two occasions and I'm relatively sure it was prepared differently each time. The sides have been hit or miss - the bean & basil salad was incredible, but the pasta salad has been bland both times I've gotten it, and the curried cauliflower soup wasn't all that curried. The pastries are usually good, though!  There are often "special" lattes on a tiny little board you can barely see on the counter, but the staff don't always know what they are or how to make them. Today I saw they had a London Fog Latte listed on there, so I ordered it (it's one of my faves) and the cashier had no idea what I was talking about. The other person behind the counter said she wasn't sure how to make it either, and it turned out exactly as bad as you'd expect, which is probably my own fault for going ahead and ordering it anyway. The cashier made some comment about how "he" needs to stop coming up with these crazy lattes, but a London Fog Latte isn't some random barista concoction -- it's a pretty common drink to see on a coffee shop menu. But also, if you have a specials board, shouldn't you maybe learn how to make drinks you haven't heard of before? I mean, people are bound to order them when you're advertising them separately.   Overall, it's OK, I guess. It's not so terrible that I would say "no, definitely don't waste your time with this place!" but I'd highly recommend going in with low expectations.

iQXUvYn-qlvl2ibnE7Twow.text: such a cute space!! even has a conference space upstairs. be sure to check out their old timey phone booth.  excellent prices. serves illy coffee.

bEyEqV-CfIx0nBL77UrnGQ.text: Awesome coffee every time and fire snacks and pastries. Didnt order a sandwich but the prices looked very reasonably priced

vPxtB6cWHdE9jIQC7S7uvA.text: Excellent atmosphere! Large space but intimate! Perfect spot for studying/good conversation!

z1I0GeZNcSkfvNnedxeRcg.text: As a tea drinker, I get the yummy Chai Latte. This small coffee shop, nestled in the downtown of Carnegie, PA, has a comfortable, relaxed atmosphere. I'm so glad it's here!

JXga8i1hMtBjj8YnCtfvFw.text: Found this place while on a work trip in Pittsburgh. Reminds me of the cute little cafes from the Short North in Columbus, OH. Certainly out of place for this small rural town; but so happy the owners put the time and effort into creating it! Great coffee, delicious pastries, and fantastic atmosphere. Only other options I found so far have been Starbucks, or going into the city. For 10 extra minutes on the highway, I'm going back today to do some work. Definitely worth the drive.

2EehhDrl7_Pp0ec9IYCV3g.text: Carnegie Coffee Company is my spot! I love it there. They have refurbished the old post office. Comfortable seating, decent Wi-Fi and great coffee and tea. Love it!  I have also tried a variety of their assorted pastries. Delicious. They also do sandwiches, salads, and have a soup of the day. They turkey sandwich on a croissant is beyond amazing. Fresh ingredients and prepared quickly I love it.  Service is ALWAYS friendly and efficient.  It can get quite busy and the comfortable seating can be a hard to come by, but there isn't a bad seat in the house. They also have a great upstairs. I like to come and work here on the weekends. Definitely stop by and enjoy a cup of delicious coffee.

VnE_-WEzm1mksSjKPZNXtg.text: Carnegie Coffee continues to be my favorite local spot to spend my mornings. A huge fan of illy coffee, it's hard to pass up just a simple medium roast, but the espresso drinks are so amazing.. Almond torte latte, salted caramel latte.. Need I say any more?   They also have Sunday brunch which has been excellent. During my most recent stop I had the egg nog French toast and it was delicious! They have a small rotating menu every Sunday. There are also great lunch options but I have yet to stop in for lunch - next on my list!   Definitely check out Carnegie Coffee.. Another great Main Street organization helping to revitalize Carnegie.

lx2uUDRjmumKJczBgTmjLw.text: Great coffee, which is why they get 3 stars, but less than stellar customer service from the woman taking our order.  The man who made the coffee; however, made up for the chill at the register as he knew his stuff.  Delicious, well done coffee, but I could have done without the pretension attitude when we ordered and therefore, unless I am purposely in Carnegie for something else wouldn't drive over for it.

AY9YkeOXmFLexwHs9hztzA.text: One of the cutest coffee shops I've been too here in Pittsburgh! I ordered a Bianca and a breakfast sandwich and everything was delicious with a great price! I will definitely be frequenting this place

T4eKAnTghalmeVU4Dil5dQ.text: Their coffee is amazing and the space is cozy and welcoming. I love the hints of social justice movements & causes that are around the space on posters, and obviously those type of posts on Facebook. I will be having my bridal shower here and Sue, the event coordinator, is so informative, attentive & incredibly thoughtful. Easily my favorite coffee shop in Pittsburgh.

EJ45dqFWxvBiQtZAc2M_zw.text: By far my favorite coffee shop in the 'Burgh!  It's the old Carnegie Post Office repurposed into an amazing and inviting space!  Cozy chairs are paired together to curl up in and read a book or have a conversation.  The coffee is top notch-I usually get a Shakerato.   And all of the food is delicious and prepared fresh.  If you haven't been here, you need to check it out!

Qp5uGt61s8nN9wdT4wQ_7A.text: This quaint little coffee shop is exactly what we need more of! It's adorable decor and unique sweet coffees. If you haven't tried it yet, skip Starbucks next time and try it out. You won't be disappointed!

uoHplq4YIalNuJJ4vX-cHw.text: My friend and I decided to take a girls trip to Pittsburgh and NYC back in July. We had an afternoon of shopping in Pittsburgh and wanted a little pick-me-up, so we checked out Carnegie Coffee Company! This place is seriously SO COOL. I believe the establishment used to be an old post office so the design of the coffee house is very unique. Lots of vintage furniture that you can cozy up with your tea/coffee and read a good book! We went during the week so it was pretty quiet. The staff was super friendly and the prices were very affordable (you don't have to pay $5 bucks for a latte like at Starbucks!).  Overall, if you're in the area it's definitely worth stopping by. :)

czicYXmKgfBsfke5exBdDA.text: My first visit but after all that great reviews I am disappointed. I come here for a latte and wifi. The machine is not working so I ordered an iced coffee instead. I had danish and its cold not warmed up. The wifi is not working at all. Even though the staff are friendly and the place is nice.  I also ordered sandwich to go and she didn't make it she forgot about it and she made another customers orders and ignored me thats really rude.

WbHnjXaL22-ASedsIuJJxg.text: Just visited on a Sunday afternoon. 1 barista. People lined up. Extremely slow service. Girl in back was making breakfast sandwiches with her bare hands, no gloves. No thanks.   Please have a more professional approach to your business, especially on a busy Sunday. Customer service is more important than the cashier's multi-colored hair.

I ordered a caramel macchiato with double espresso, and it was delicious with the perfect balance of bitter and sweet. The cafe had a vintage feel and was very spacious. I will definitely be coming back to spend more time in this unique & cozy space!

The staff is attentive no matter how busy it is and its two floor atmosphere is wonderful for dates, working, reading, etc. Music is always on point too (though sometimes a bit *too* loud, but I'll let it slide as it seems to pump up the baristas...a happy barista is always important)!

3-EJLXO0kkD90OqppmrE9w.text: I held my sister's bridal shower here today and it couldn't have been more perfect. The staff was so easy to work with, made menu modifications for us, had a beautiful and delicious spread of food. The place basically decorated itself and little was needed to make it feel charming and delightful. If you are looking to host any sort of party, consider them. You won't be paying over the top fees, they are easy to work with, and their food is AMAZING. Can't recommend them enough.

Kzd8bZDWC5TU_PvDmDqVSg.text: We recently moved to Carnegie and went to Carnegie Coffee Company for the first time this morning. They were incredibly accommodating, making me an egg white breakfast sandwich even though egg whites weren't listed on the menu. Delicious sandwich and latte, and my boyfriend enjoyed his Western breakfast sandwich as well. We will definitely be back!

wEVmDKz-CKhcY9G6Vqgzig.text: I love this coffee shop! Great coffee & espresso drinks, really tasty baked goods including the giant fun cakes (red velvet w/ peppermint icing = :D), and solid food! Their brunch is always solid and a great price. The service is friendly as well!   As far as the setup of the space, the downstairs is definitely more lounge-y and relaxed, with cushy sofas, bar style seating, and a community library! Feels like a cozy living room :) Upstairs includes more comfortable table seating as well as a big conference table type setup for a workspace. Upstairs usually feels to me like the area for people to do work with the shop's wifi, while the downstairs is more lively, with lots of conversation, coffee noises, and people coming in and out of the next door pharmacy.   The only note I have about this shop, and it is not a huge deal in my opinion, is that it seems that the mug refill policy is dependent on whoever is running the register. I typically bring in a reusable mug of some sort to get a hot coffee, and my refills have been either $1, the cost of a small coffee in a ceramic mug, or the cost of a small coffee. Again, not big deal as it's a small cost difference, but it would be nice to have consistency in the cost. As a customer, I would like to not be overcharged, but also knowing that CCC is a small business, I wouldn't want them inadvertently undercharging!

XjD37FnJVRVBg8_BY_088w.text: We just held a bridal shower there today for my future daughter in law. The venue is PERFECT for what we wanted! The staff is AMAZING, attentive, and so easy to work with. The food was beautifully laid out and delicious! We looked at so many places to have this shower but this was BY FAR the best and most reasonably priced. They were flexible with the hours and included an hour before for decorating and an hour after for breaking down. We never felt pressured to hurry up and leave. We were in the balcony/loft area which was a nice, private space. If you are looking to host a bridal or baby shower this is a gorgeous place for it!  I highly recommend them!!

TDYyokZTwdeF0YHdQvamZQ.text: Great little coffee shop! Everyone was very friendly the breakfast and coffee was so good! My boyfriend and I enjoy doing work here, it's busy but quite enough to get things done. Love that they modernized an old building and restored it to a cute coffee shop!

KWsEe0hq7YusqRBFs72-RA.text: I never liked coffee before but when a friend of mine got a me a drink from here I was pleasantly surprised. Def worth the try if you aren't a huge coffee fan.

2LTzd46IPpB9EuhNQYul4A.text: I asked my husband to find me a coffee shop between the airport and the city and he picked Carnegie Coffee Company.  Like everyone says, it's in an old Post Office.  Inside, it is huge, one of the biggest independent coffee shops I've been in.  I came early in the morning on a weekday, and it was very quiet (people wise) at first but gradually filled up and became hoppin' and boppin' and pretty packed with people.  There are two levels, and within the downstairs, there are lots of nooks and different areas.  It's quite the opposite of a vast rectangle.  There are easy chairs, tables, couches: lots of options.  They use the Italian terms for their espresso drinks, which is a nice touch.  I ordered an 8oz white mocha and it was excellent.  The underlying espresso was well made.   The milk froth was rich and thick.  It had a well-blended, well-rounded warm flavor that was not too sweet.

CliWC976L1bRevb4FiFA4Q.text: I love it here! Right in my neighborhood! Nice staff and owners. Very clean. Cute and eclectic tables and chairs all around. I enjoy trying some of the monthly special coffees they come up with. The homemade baked goods are also delicious!

VhvA71isvFtYjbXyVcJdqA.text: I visited CCC this summer when I held a meeting for one of the organizations that I am a member of.  They were very responsive and accommodating when I inquired after reserving a private space.  As it turns out, their conference table is only semi-private.  It's tucked away in the back corner of their second floor loft, but it worked just fine for our purposes.  I ordered a breakfast sandwich, which was fine.  (Not bad at all, not spectacular either.) I had already drank my morning coffee, so I skipped that.  I'd definitely like to return and give it a try, since it's hard to find illy coffee in the States.  I really love the atmosphere and decor of this place.  A real gem in Carnegie.

pNM3ofUuS0rxD0aHarHZLw.text: Regardless of how good the coffee or breakfast sandwiches are, don't go in the mornings, unless you don't mind waiting for over 25mins for your coffee and food.

PsEdSHUTEPZZJQwCr4Myig.text: This is by far my favorite coffee house in the city. Not only is it located in the quaint downtown of Carnegie, but it's the city's old post office. The coffee and specialty drinks are made with the best ingredients and their breakfast sandwiches and various pastries are delicious! The spot is also very eclectic and has plenty of room to go read a book or bring a new view to your "home office."  The owner and staff are always upbeat and very friendly. This spot also has a vast amount of parking on the street and a large parking lot just across the street. You won't be disappointed visiting this coffee house!

aDKb1xChUHv4AD-dqOxn8Q.text: Charming coffee shop with great food and coffee, this place is wonderful.  The building used to be a post office, so you can still see some of the old postal boxes.  There are lots of windows to let the sunshine in.  There are 2 floors with lots of different choices for sitting and talking.  The staff is very friendly.    I did find the music a little too loud, which is not conducive to conversations, but this was the only negative.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie Coffee Company - Carnegie, PA, United States

MWC-Kr7_ZOEAvGB4lqgmaQ.text: First of all I'd like to point out that I used to like this place. Thought I'd call in to grab a quick bite with a coffee and a bottle of spring water. Tried their Turkey club croissant. Attendant serving me seemed very aloof and shy. Anyway, aside for this sidebar issue, I had to ask where to get my 'side'. The coffee is another story. In a world filled with coffee shops, this one used to stand apart from all the other local coffee shops in the area. Now, I guess the rent must have gone up or something because I desired a little coffee in the Water and Milk concoction they served me. They kindly fixed the issue (not without a little attitude) from the young millennial who served me up with a lovely (cold/stale croissant sandwich) which although quite delicious, I have to say crumbled the moment I took the first bite. Anyhoo, I am not one to waste food, considering also I paid a measly $14.66 + a 15% tip prior to receiving my delightful combo.  I blasted a few Indian owned Starbucks franchises for skimping out on coffee content in their coffees so my expectation from a place claiming to be a coffee house, should perhaps step up their game. Dear Americans, learn to complain when things need improving, or else nothing will ever improve and the millennial generation will continue to feel inherently entitled to continue with their lackluster service and sense of 'I don't give a shit' attitude. Have a smashing day!!

km1_c5Zixr5k7PnV4MtNlw.text: It's a great space and adds a caffinated spark to an old neighborhood.  AND when you are sitting in the middle of Robinson,  it is the only place that comes up on yelp when searching coffee shops that isn't a cookie cutter corporate coffee joint.  Totally worth a visit.  The coffee and fresh baked goods  are awesome.

vm5vKBFD0-zu8q0aMf_lgA.text: Great neighborhood coffee shop. Very unique space also. Coffee is excellent and they have a nice variety of foods. Try this place if you're tired of the chains!

dhUPAjXiRgcupwcSz214uQ.text: The space is really lovely: lots of light, a nice bookshelf, comfortable seating, and not too noisy despite being lofted. Unfortunately, I wasn't too impressed with the food or drink. My ham croissant turned out to be a sandwich, and a cold one at that. That might have been okay if it was just the fillings, but the croissant itself was also cold. No one wants to eat a cold croissant, unless you like eating congealed butter. The ham was also fatty. My chai latte tasted like it came from a box, which is fine but not impressive. Given all the five star reviews, it may have just been an off day, and the bagel sandwiches do look pretty good, but I'm not sure I'd come back to find out.

JStejmOGs7DHwem3oFMFSw.text: I have been going to CCC since it opened. This is a great coffee shop but so much more. They have great pastries mada in house and also brought in from another great place - Mediterra. They use great Italian coffee and the taste is perfect. I love some of their seasonal lattes like the lavender and rose flavors. So unique and i like the basic flavors other places offer. They have great lunch and breakfast items too. Love the breakfast sandwiches. My favorite thins here is their cappuccino though, it's always made to perfection.

4A9l1aIU5cEuzT5chg8-RA.text: Carnegie coffee co deserves its spot on the Pittsburgh best coffee list. They use Lavazza coffee, which I'm impartial to, have a fully stocked pastry case with some individually packaged items (loaf cake slices), and have breakfast sandwiches on rotation in addition to a lunch menu. The interior gets its own 5 star rating from me; it's open but not loud in the way open areas with exposed industrial ceilings are, colorful but tasteful, clean, and has a loft style second floor with extra seating. Parking was easy to find around the corner, especially on a Sunday. I got the vanilla latte and Jackhammer sandwich with a side (included, and sides are on rotation as well) of red lentil soup. The latte was smooth and vanilla wasn't overpowering. I know from amateur experience how easy it is to make burnt tasting lattes that you try to cover up with extra syrup, and that wasn't the case here. The sandwich was on the lunch menu but was great as a brunch item because of the fried egg. Coming back again the next free Sunday I have!

68gcY2Piov5jCSs_t1hsKg.text: Cute little place with tons of seating. We're here during what is probably the busiest time and we could find nice seating. Upstairs is cute and provides a view of the whole place. Breakfast sandwiches were simple but tasty.

8VPbx3M3Q1dXVi8q0YPmXg.text: I just wanted to update my review to reflect the amazing experience I had hosting my son's first birthday party here on Saturday! It was just the perfect venue, not only because they have a private adorable upstairs room, but they made it so easy to organize.   The space holds up to 30 people and is super comfortable at that amount. I love the mix of table seating and couches, you can really spread out if you want to. The rate to rent the room during normal business hours is $50 an hour, which I think is totally reasonable. You choose from a simple menu of sandwiches, salads and charcuterie boards that they make in house. The food was beautifully displayed and marked appropriately. They even made special gluten free items for me and a few others.   I also like that you have the option to bring in your own desserts. If you want to serve alcohol it's $2 a head. You can also either have a coffee carafe or choose to have people order at the coffee bar. We chose the later option and it honestly wasn't a crazy amount.   I will note that communication between the event planner was excellent. She answered all of my questions promptly and made things so easy. I appreciate that, because half of planning an event is the coordination.   Definitely consider this for your next shower, birthday or get together!

I2ci0_ejo4dedEp21q0SOw.text: Cute little place! Atmosphere is amazing. Sandwiches are really good and their chipotle sauce is great as well. They serve great coffees and teas too. Definitely recommend stopping here.

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie Coffee Company - Carnegie, PA, United States. Turkey Chipotle sandwich. Even better with an extra side of the chipotle.

8LZWc-DtBnzbt7AI1Os6fA.text: The people were very nice. I got a sandwich and a peach smoothie which came out very fast and was very good. The inside is filled with beautiful paintings. Definitely would go back.

myKWf9KsHkjrOKSHku-4Ug.text: This old US Post Office has created the perfect spot for a coffee shop! Very warm and inviting inside with a nice menu. Tons of spots to sit and catch up with your friends. There is even a second level with spots to have meetings or parties!

Lx39uG5mlf5gfD9hqV5sJg.text: I love coffee shops.  For working, for meetings, for catching up with a friend.   This is a good spot that is steadily getting better over the years.  Large upstairs seating area, and small nook for the book reader types. Big huge win is that this place was originally an old post office. History is cool.    I'd love to stop in and work here more often, but the music is more pop-ish, and a little loud compared to what I feel it "should be" cuz I'm a pro coffee shop analyst.   Shakira is blasting right now. Can't make a call with that in the background.   Otherwise this place is a win.

CyEMCHPURV88q9gVcFC4Ow.text: So cute! Stopped in while waiting to meet some friends, the coffee was delicious and inexpensive, atmosphere is so calming! I sat towards the back on an orange lounge chair with plenty of books within reach. There are plenty of seating options and areas depending on how many people you have with you, and all look comfy and cozy!

8PciXRU-wnO1gvSy38bUMw.text: I still cannot believe that I now live in the same neighborhood as this darling coffee shop and cafe. The business operates out of the former Carnegie Post Office, so you can actually still see some of the postal boxes when you place your order. I am admittedly not a coffee drinker, but I know it's a big deal here - the cafe's claim to fame is being the only coffee house in Western Pennsylvania serving Illy coffee.  I personally come here for the sweets and the smoothies (and hopefully one day, to try their breakfasts and sandwiches). The smoothies are always fantastic - not too thick, not too runny, good at balancing the ingredients and getting the flavors right - and once you add some whipped cream on top you'll have quite a tasty drink to brighten your day. I know that some of the sweets come from another business, but I believe others are indeed made in house, such as an amazing fresh brownie that I told myself I wouldn't eat in one sitting. Oops.  Most importantly, unlike many shops - where I'm perfectly happy purchasing and carrying on with my day - this little coffee place screams to me "stay!" And it's not just because of the phone booth that's included in the decor, although that makes me grin; it's the cute tables, the cozy nooks, and the fact that one section literally feels like a lounge, complete with bookshelves. All of it is clean and bright and cheerful, and I really want to set aside time to just hang out here with a book. The place was designed with exactly that intention (i.e. a European cafe), and one day I plan to take advantage of that design to the fullest.   Whether you stick around or you do get your order to go, this place is totally worth visiting. The staff are always nice, the place is downright beautiful, and everything I've ordered has been delicious. I will definitely be back!

aJi7m36AmA2YmtY5fvdYSg.text: Every time when I want coffee  I'm here at Carnegie Coffee.  For my opinion it is the best place for coffee break around this area.  Friendly personal perfect service, nice and clean   Will recommend to everyone.  5*****

OKCewCIjclIxOvSxX7TLig.text: I really love Carnegie Coffee. It's a fantastic little neighborhood coffee shop. The employees are friendly (especially the owner), and the coffee, other beverages, and food are high quality. I also really like the atmosphere - it's bright and clean, but also has a uniqueness to r because of the historic building it's in. I really love that they used old mailboxes from the original post office as the base for the front counter. It's super charming!   Not only is Carnegie Coffee great for your every day Coffee fix, or a place to work or study, but they also offer a nice little event space. I liked the atmosphere so much that I chose to have my bridal shower there on a Sunday. It was great, not overly expensive, and they were extremely easy and pleasant to work with! We had a great time! I highly recommend looking into Carnegie Coffee for small events like baby showers or bridal showers... or even a young girls tea party! It's a wonderful spot!

HSoKUjQ3p3Pxeo8Cz0Z89Q.text: I stopped over here on my way home from Bloomfield to see what makes this place so special. It is located in the old Post office building directly across from the pay parking lot in the center of Main St in Carnegie.   They serve lunches here as well as desserts in addition to coffee and tea. Since I was already caffeined out from my tea that I just had in Bloomfield I deferred the expresso for a dark roast to have less caffeine. Prices are very reasonable for the sizes you can order..As I looked at the various desserts I saw one gingerbread man which is my favorite Christmas cookie. I decided to  have it with my coffee.  I learned from the counterman that their desserts come from Mediterra bakery. I have been to that bakery before and have been well pleased with their offerings. I took my coffee and settled in the back room where they have a library of books you can look at along with and old style phone booth. They have low couches and chairs where you can sit and relax and there are other tables that I noticed if you wish to work from a laptop.  i got to chatting with two people who were finishing up a demi cup of expresso latte which I was told was very good.  My coffee was not overbearing but just right once i added my cream and sugar. This was indeed one of the better coffees in quite some time. The gingerbread man was so good I polished him off in no time flat!  inside this same building is a Medicine shoppe and does have a handicapped accessible ramp if you are not able to climb the stairs. I like the fact that it is centrally located and gives you a place to relax and unwind.  Highly recommend when you visit Carnegie's business district!

-DVR8RLl2d1Vu5S4Vj9H1Q.text: Beautiful space, large enough to find a comfy seat but separated into little nooks with various seating types so you can have a quiet conversation, read a book, or meet for a work engagement. Had a latte with almond milk and a touch of honey -- tasted great but I wish they offered local honey, especially since they are a local business and could easily support a local honey maker. Great to see they offer some pastries made at a local bakery. They offer some really nice breakfast and lunch sandwich combinations with options for meat-eaters and vegetarians alike. I just wish they tried to offer some organic, hormone-free, and/or locally-sourced ingredients for some items like eggs, meats, cheeses, and/or veggies. Big kudos for the vegetarian/unique food options as well as the inviting/comforting space. Would be nice to see more focus on quality ingredients for food.

7lg70kni8mVNp2KkNDxkOA.text: The coffee is good, the food is pretty good especailly for the price, the people are friendly. But if you're going to a coffee shop to get work done this is not the best place. They have the seating, but good luck focusing with the blasting of upbeat music.

LVoALS4CETh0Rni_h1Oo6A.text: Good bones The place is bright and beautiful. There's a good selection of different kinds of seating, including some comfy low-slung armchairs for reading. This could be a five-star cafe with one big and two easy changes. Big: the coffee is bland Illy stuff, basically K-cups on tap. The space deserves third-wave coffee. Easy, but very important: 1. the WiFi is terrible, *when* it works, which is not often. 2. The vast majority of the seating is not in range of a power outlet. I have not tried the food.

LgeHZIvdqb5u8mQH8o0H3g.text: I don't know why I keep coming back here, actually, I think I am done. They take an unforgivably long time to make a coffee. I actually timed it once. I was the only person in line, there was one drink order ahead of me and it took 12 minutes to make a medium latte with skim milk. 12 freaking minutes. The guy making drinks seemed like he was on something, he started the drink before mine, then dumped it, then poured syrup, then dumped it, then he got a new cup and started over again. WTF dude? Seriously. Then he just completely stopped making drinks to talk to a customer. I was about 2 minutes away from leaving my drink because he was going to make me late for work.

eECtuOt6I_G3MYFKE8isTg.text: This rating is for lunch not coffee. Came here for lunch with some coworkers. I ordered a turkey sandwich and was a little disappointed in the size (for the price) as well as the turkey, as I was expecting lunch-meat turkey. This was hot sliced turkey.   I ordered the red peppers with hummus as a side, and was glad that this was an option rather than chips . I did enjoy the hummus; however there was not nearly enough peppers .   I did really enjoy the ambiance of this place and I would love to return for a cup of coffee.  I just would probably skip the lunch next time.

FOpGNaq47wpnNl9ulPs3JA.text: Delicious coffee/espresso and yummy treats plus and awesome building.   This was my first time here and I usually like to ask if your have something they're know for...weird ish I know but I go to so many local coffee shops a lot actually have one think the do exceptionally well and or have something that is fantastically more popular than the rest. Well I asked the right people, while they don't have one thing they're know for they have a ton of amazing choices and one of the workers ( I believe she might be the owners) favorites is a rose and cinnamon latte and I said sign me up to that. Boy was I so happy with the outcome. It's not too over powering and so delicious. I would I highly recommend it. And this coffee shop. The staff was super friendly and again everything was delicious. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Carnegie Coffee Company - Carnegie, PA, United States. Rose and cinnamon latte. Way too good!

j5cAY5DqZUHtAS0FHj1phA.text: I love CCC for some delicious coffee/tea drinks and lunch. Such a cool space with the old post office transformed into this coffee shop. Space to eat or relax alone or chat with friends. Also quiet if you need a place to get some work done or study. Parking across the street in pay lot or regular street parking. For food options, they have soups, salads and sandwiches which are made fresh and quick. Also some ready made options in the cooler. Staff is always friendly and service is quick. Prices are average. My husband and I both ate lunch with drinks for I think around $20. I highly recommend the vegetable panini and roasted pepper soup for lunch. The sandwich was packed with veggies and was not at all greasy, exactly how I like it. The roasted pepper soup was the perfect blend of sweet and spicy. I only wish I could get here more often! If you're into coffee shops, you must this place on your list!

NmdbAgARtkCCeuNTXUEuqg.text: Adorable, hip coffee shop.  I've heard good things about this place so a friend and I met for breakfast on a Sunday morning.  We both got breakfast sandwiches that were better than the traditional sandwiches you get at other coffee shops.  I had the western omelette on an everything bagel and my friend got the Florentine omelette on a croissant. My vanilla latte was the right amount of sweetness and the design with the foam on the top was adorable.  They have little nooks and crannies with chairs and books scattered throughout where you can hang out and the order counter still has the original post office boxes.  Carnegie is becoming such a chic, cool place to be and I will definitely be back to visit this place.

jyc-ynt24lR1dlJLcvatEg.text: The coffee is awesome.  The only drawback is a lot of the time there is only one person there so it can take some time to get your latte.  The staff is always friendly though and try to get through everyones orders as quick as possible.

i4FmQvVU-Q7ew_yMkQQZyw.text: Cute little place. Nice place to sit and work mid morning or mid day but you might need ear plugs because of the music. Free internet. Free parking in the back (but just 4 or 5 spots). Iced coffee was delicious but definitely pricey. A small iced coffee was 3.50 + tip. Next time, I'll try the food. They close pretty early at 7 PM.

E0ivCGtrn-JZZ7PUX9abVA.text: I LOVE this place! They have a stamp card for every coffee purchase. Great atmosphere and design. I love how they kept pieces of the old post office to preserve the history of Carnegie! Beautiful bookshelves which you can help yourself to too!

pCkOCRXUz7ZOs-i34MhuyQ.text: Really nice atmosphere to get together and catch up with friends, or for work meetings. Oh, and the coffee's quite good as well. So much better than going to Starbucks!

ENror9E2E9iETXB9tZsp9w.text: Clean, friendly, happy place. Italian coffee and all kinds of deliciousness. I will def try to come back here.

T9RsiiU_o1-Gp8BxzAf8QA.text: Great atmosphere. Great coffee. Nice choices for snacks. Such a nice spot to spend time alone or hanging out with friends!

kkjxWRsNI3jEANkrLQInPg.text: This place is great! The coffee is delicious and the staff are super friendly! Had some fresh fruit, egg sandwich and a salted caramel latte. The best. Can't wait to come back.

0dyzR5JendcF6kyNEvqvPg.text: LOVE this place. I started working in the area and found this coffee shop. They have great coffee, awesome lunch menu (the soups are so good) and great customer service.

Tt3jSfA5k-l1NhlKoPQi8g.text: Happy to see this place continues to improve! When they first opened, I was really excited to have a coffee shop in Carnegie, and loved the bright/open feel of the place... but the wait times were always terrible, and I often had to leave without ordering to avoid being late to work. The past few times, this hasn't been a problem at all, although I definitely enjoy coming here with friends to sit and catch up instead of getting anything to go. I'm a bit of a coffee snob so I wish they had more variety in their regular coffee selection, but my usual latte or americano is always good. Pastries are great but I've never tried their other food offerings.

UxvCyc6DvWrB-zry2sF54A.text: Delicious coffee and great atmosphere! I didn't try any food but will definitely on my next trip.

UzOzIj8kqFKmpkbMXsCf4Q.text: This place is beautiful and has amazing coffee.  If you have to be inside on a beautiful day, it's perfect.  Amazing coffee, too.  Creative mixes and elegant flavors.

NLlFQum2Zf2kDgREEu28kQ.text: Quaint. Bright. Calming. Energizing. Love the use of the space they have and how this place brightens my Sunday mornings.

YILYi2NQ8V0TpYyULJlBeg.text: This place oozes old-school charm without trying too hard--the coffee bar sits atop a row of old mailboxes, and an actual telephone booth hangs out nonchalantly in the corner. Top that off with a loft space with comfy chairs and a great selection of books, and you've got a great place to lose yourself for a few hours...or more! After a great Yelp event here, I had mentally bookmarked this place and when I found myself hungry in Carnegie, I stopped in with a friend for a sandwich. While service wasn't quick, it was certainly friendly, and they happily obliged my request to press my BLT panini-style--toasty, toasty deliciousness. For $8, you get a freshly made sandwich and side, and there's a pitcher of water around for those of us who don't forsake the tap. I'm not in Carnegie much, but I just might have to make it out there more often, especially with ample parking available for $0.25/hour (but bring quarters!)...beats Oakland prices any day!

rVWHY8Ems7FvXKJKtS1MYQ.text: What a terrific spot!  A beautiful place to have a great cup of coffee.

FoeTBWH6wmToOWFm_7IbTA.text: Carnegie is a beautiful space. The decor is very classic and rustic. There is an abundance of space and seating and even offers a balcony to overlook the "living room" area. We were traveling from Brooklyn, NY as an acoustic duo. We played a short 1 hour set and had a great time. They serve Illy Coffee which is also a plus and the owner, Ashley, was extremely generous and hospitable. I look forward to coming back through Pittsburgh and revisiting Carnegie Coffee! Thanks so much for your warm hospitality. - Anthony BRIDGES Brooklyn

wChsOcXU5HtCJO6T4HpDQg.text: Great atmosphere, coffee and breakfast.  The owner was really nice.  Can't wait to meet friends there, have date night with my husband, play games with our kids or relax and read a book!

bCicEdHTq9fGSyJJMNrJbw.text: My husband and I have always been complaining that there are no good places to walk/ride a bike, or even drive to near our house in Crafton.  Especially coffee shops.  We pride ourselves on finding the best espresso, and are always comparing different places in the city.  We found out about a coffee shop that opened in Carnegie and had to give it a chance, even though we were in the frame of mind, that it wouldn't be that great.  I mean, it is carnegie, and we have been holding out hope for great businesses to open there, we have been let down thus far.  When we arrived at the old Post Office (there location) we were blow away by the amount of wrok they put into the place.  It was gorgeous, spacious, and clean.  Very modern and bright looking, with an upstairs that begs for a wine bar, or event space.  O.K we thought, let's see what the beans are about.  They boast Illy brand, and their espresso was right where it needed to be to keep us coming back for more.  We are already planning our next Saturday's weekly bike ride.  We finally got what we wanted, a perfect spot to bring in the locals.  I truly hope everyone supports this place, and we can continue to build Main Street up to what it should be (a mini Lawrenceville would be nice)  It looks like it is on it's way!   Great job Carnegie Coffee.  Keep it up, and we will see you soon!

s-7egTEK7rDZcrIX6H0bUg.text: This is a great local coffee shop!! The environment is bright and inviting with huge windows and shelves full of books. Each time I have ordered an espresso drink, the barista  has created a beautiful design in my foam- this makes the drink so much more enjoyable :) The breakfast sandwiches are also delightful and are made fresh as you wait!

bh8UcYvUDt26dHcUVX7LBA.text: Happy to have a local coffee shop in my neighborhood. It won't become my go to destination for top notch coffee in pittsburgh as there are other local shops that serves a better product (coffee roaster wise) but I will definitely support them. I'm glad they offer local baked goods and lunch items, with that said, I'm surprised they use illy coffee which is far from being local or even remotely a decent coffee roaster. I wish they would use a local coffee roaster ie; commonplace, 19 coffee,  or even perhaps aldo coffee co. There are far better choices close to home that focuses on more sustainable, in season, coffees. I enjoyed the minimalist decor and found it to be inviting and friendly. What a great idea to pair with the medicine shoppe, it'll be good for business as they both can thrive off each other and I'm sure reduce overheads. Smart. They have potential as they improve their barista skills with time and practice and maybe hopefully change their coffee roaster.

P1LSX-CLAZXOMedMp0JL4A.text: This is one of my most favorite spots in Pittsburgh! The illy coffee is great! It's the perfect place to hang out and relax for awhile. And the food is always on point!

vOfA6w2seMYYKrTFQBECsw.text: Love this place and the coffee. The owners are great. This is now my go to place for meet ups - social or business. Simple, delicious food. Parking is right across the street, plenty of it.  It's really really easy to get to from the Rt. 79 Carnegie exit - so don't let parkway construction get in your way.

BnLBZePU15a0h9SjQXxCJA.text: Excellent coffee, for an affordable price.  They have a small selection of sandwiches and salads for lunch, as well as pastries and a breakfast sandwich.  Service is fast and friendly.  I'll be back.

TMbhnS2dS9u5UVOXYhHwag.text: I was thrilled to learn that there was a coffee shop opening up in my hometown of Carnegie. I'm a local student and have my favorite coffee shops on and around campus, but I've never been able to find a good study locale when I'm back in town to visit my parents for a long weekend. Carnegie Coffee Company is everything I was looking for. Right when I walked in, the staff greeted me and was very friendly as I reminisced about the old post office (which is what this particular locale was when I was growing up!). In that regard, they have repurposed a number of details from the old post office, which I thought was a lovely touch. I spent a Sunday morning/early afternoon here, and the ambiance was relaxing and quiet, despite the steady flow of patrons coming in and out for their Sunday morning coffee and newspapers.  As for the food/beverages, Carnegie Coffee Co. serves Illy products, which I've had the fortune to try at the original Dozen Bake Shop in Squirrel Hill (RIP) as well as outside of Pittsburgh. I treated myself to a white mocha, which had just enough sweetness to keep me from attacking the doughnuts, which they bring in daily from local favorite Big Daddy Donuts in Crafton. I did splurge on some soup for lunch, which was tomato arugula on the day of my visit. Served with a baguette and butter (!), the soup was flavorful and warm with an ever so slight chunk factor that gave the soup good texture. It definitely hit the spot on a somewhat dreary summer Sunday mid-morning.  Final verdict: I will be back to Carnegie Coffee Company whenever I need to get some studying done to the tunes of a warm cup of coffee and just a hint of childhood nostalgia for this Carnegie girl.

zy7IDepPa79f0GJCiWcXMg.text: Good coffee and coffee drinks.  I have also had bagel and delicious salted caramel biscotti.  I doubt they make their own snacks but wherever they come from they are good.   The old post office building is worth popping into just to look around, well done.

_8GkOPOSyJyPEnFxSgQBUw.text: Great coffee. I suggest the vanilla steamer. Delicious and the highlight of my morning. The decor is beautiful and if you want a nice sit-down-and-drink-your-coffee experience. You can sit downstairs on the cute chairs, or upstairs on the comfy couch. They offer wifi which is nice although sometimes it's not the best. But they do have a wide array of food options.   I've heard this building used to be a post office and that just makes this place even cooler! The counter is on top of some old mailboxes! And all the furniture is classic and beautiful.   And finally, a really nice feature is the convenient store located in the lobby. Very, um, convenient!

_FBIg5Nn41fczlOMgL9Pbw.text: Great atmosphere, alright food, can't speak to the coffee because I don't drink coffee. The baristas were friendly to the people coming in, many who seemed to be regulars. Biggest complaint: their wifi didn't work. I was here in August of 2015.

J7Hd2WgQ63KP_7OG7i1JYw.text: Very nice space. Came her for some tea and conversation with family. They offer a variety of coffees, tea, that's made you you. Also bottled sodas that were interesting flavors. They have sandwiches and light fare. Vegetarian selections. Different types of Pastry. 2 in my party ordered iced coffee and enjoyed it. My husband and I had iced black tea. We were not thrilled with it. It was very weakly brewed. Also they were out of most pastries. After only giving it 2 stars though I would return because I did enjoy the atmosphere and will request the tea to be brewed strong.

cm-lPf6s7bulocR16IcuLA.text: This place used to be a favorite of mine. I would come several times a week on my mornings off for some hot chocolate and a pastry. But their food selection has unfortunately gone way downhill over the past few months. They used to have a unique selection of pastries/desserts every day like seven layer bars, and now all they ever offer are bland scones and croissants. I finally asked them about it and they informed me their baker no longer worked there. I really hope they find a new one or train someone else because that was a huge draw of coming here. I now have less and less desire to come back each time I visit, which is unfortunate since it's such a cool looking spot.

GFwW7s-SK2LiMDyADc4YSg.text: Love the coffee!  Bring any out of town guests here on the way home from the airport!

FQhMOpI2x_x1obXvmnhNnQ.text: This may be my new favorite coffee shop! Great coffee. Good food. Cool atmosphere. Friendly staff.

HSc4sQYUGaklllKINmsikg.text: Great ambiance, great fresh food and caring staff! Great way to start your day or improve your day.

4haawdVY9ctQIPyWJEy61w.text: The staff was super friendly. The coffee was good and it was affordable. I ordered a Carmello and my friend ordered a bold drip. I also bought a bottle of cherry soda for my fiance. They have some cute little extras in the soda case here! The atmosphere was quiet and lovely. Very adorable. Will definitely be returning.

HufRQ4wc2OJ-sqg4JmBmCA.text: The ambiance and the interior of this make it a great place to have a quiet chat when meeting a first date.  I highly recommend it as a location if you are meeting someone for the first time or reconnecting with an old friend.  It has a quiet vibe that allowed me to melt into conversation for two hours over my coffee.  The coffee was great and my date loved his latte.

DCmnx4umj-RM-oMhgqzkPw.text: Cool space with lots of different places to sit. Coffee is the best - everything I've ever ordered has been great, esp the tiramisu latte. Wifi works well. Not too many power outlets upstairs though.

eXaBhnwJG3hIChXDoj8GvA.text: If you're looking for good coffee, fresh food, and a chill space this is the best bet in Pittsburgh! We came on a rainy Saturday morning and ate breakfast here while visiting, and I would definitely return the next time I'm in town.

w5n757eeOSGNZ_P9pZ-bQA.text: I've been coming here almost daily for the past few months as I have been studying for an exam, and they have been amazing. The coffee is fresh, the food is good and everything is affordable. They have a huge upstairs space with a conference table that is great for doing work. I would come and spend hours here and get a lot of work done. The baked goods are seriously out of this world. The people are nice and the atmosphere is great. Parking is cheap (seriously $1 for two hours!) and if you're lucky you can find a spot out back. I'll be back even after the bar exam!

7XMrdRR1SY2Wz5XzMVGkgQ.text: Carnegie Coffee is such an awesome addition to the town! From what I understand, it used to be a post office and the architecture is outstanding. They have a wonderful selection of teas, coffees, baked goods, and a refrigerated case with sandwiches and sides. The best part of the coffee shop is the atmosphere, with the high ceilings, sleek & comfortable furnishings and welcoming charm. I've been many times and have always had a great experience!

gvfmfewUCKFJpTK9dtKPpQ.text: I discovered a little gem. Maybe not little as the space is huge and beautifully set up. Coffee is Illy brand and that speaks for itself. Music is very quiet, you come there to read a book, work, or just stop by to say hi to the nice barista. My new fav coffee place!

Qr0Qpx6bdIGFIT6RWTMtvA.text: Carnegie does not have a Starbucks and will never need one by the quality of the coffee and food at the Carnegie Coffee Company I only had the espresso and a salad but the espresso was rich and full of caramel sweetness with a good crema. The Carnegie  salad had ripe tomatoes in March! And the home made ranch dressing was quite good.the home made ranch dressing was quite good. Go there and see for yourself.
